thread.title: BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets
thread.title_full: BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets

author: BEN WALKER
title: BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets
text:
Matt Slocum BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets 
Kansas City Royals' Lorenzo Cain celebrates after scoring on a hit by Eric Hosmer against the Toronto Blue Jays during the eight inning in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum) Julie Jacobson BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets 
New York Mets starting pitcher Jacob deGrom throws in the outfield during a voluntary team workout, Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in New York. After sweeping the Chicago Cubs to win the NLCS, the Mets will play in the World Series against the winner of the ALCS. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Tim Donnelly BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets 
Kansas City Royals celebrates their 4-3 win against the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Tim Donnelly) Julie Jacobson BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets 
New York Mets relief pitcher Jeurys Familia throws in the outfield during a voluntary workout, Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in New York. After sweeping the Chicago Cubs to win the NLCS, the Mets will play in the World Series against the winner of the ALCS. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Julie Jacobson BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets 
New York Mets manager Terry Collins answers questions for members of the media during a voluntary team workout, Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in New York. After sweeping the Chicago Cubs to win the NLCS, the Mets will play in the World Series against the winner of the ALCS. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Matt Slocum BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets 
Kansas City Royals relief pitcher Wade Davis, left, and catcher Salvador Perez celebrates their 4-3 win against the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum) Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 3:28 am | Updated: 3:45 am, Sat Oct 24, 2015. BBQ or bagels? A tasty World Series set, Royals meet Mets Associated Press | 
Yoenis Cespedes launching long drives, Lorenzo Cain dashing to catch them. Noah Syndergaard zinging 100 mph heat, Alcides Escobar trying to catch up. 
The pitching-rich New York Mets, boosted by Daniel Murphy's power surge. The plucky Kansas City Royals, aiming to atone for last year's near-miss.
